question: Oral administration of small doses of either ______ is another contraceptive method used by the females.
Oral administration of small doses of either progestogens or ______ combinations is another contraceptive method used by the females.
They are used in the form of ______ and hence are popularly called the pills.
Pills have to be taken daily for a period of ______ days.
Pills have to be taken daily starting preferably within the first ______ days of menstrual cycle.
After a gap of ______ days during which menstruation occurs, it has to be repeated.
Pills inhibit ______ and implantation.
Pills alter the quality of ______ mucus to prevent/retard entry of sperms.
Pills are very effective with lesser ______ and are well accepted by the females.
______ is the new oral contraceptive for the females containing a non-steroidal preparation.
Saheli is a ‘______’ pill with very few side effects and high contraceptive value.
Saheli contains a ______ preparation.
Progestogens alone or in combination with ______ can also be used by females as injections or implants.
Progestogens can be used as injections or ______ under the skin.
The mode of action of implants is similar to that of ______.
The effective periods of progestogen injections or implants are much ______.
Administration of progestogens, progestogen-estrogen combinations or IUDs within ______ hours of coitus can be used as emergency contraceptives.
Emergency contraceptives are effective in avoiding possible pregnancy due to ______ or casual unprotected intercourse.
Surgical methods are also called ______.
Surgical methods are generally advised for the male/female partner as a ______ method to prevent any more pregnancies.
Vasectomy and tubectomy are examples of ______ methods.
MTP stands for ______ or induced abortion.
Nearly ______ to ______ million MTPs are performed in a year all over the world.
MTPs account to ______ of the total number of conceived pregnancies in a year.
Government of India legalised MTP in the year ______.
Government of India legalised MTP with some strict ______ to avoid misuse.
Restrictions on MTP are important to check indiscriminate and illegal ______ foeticides.
MTP helps to get rid of ______ pregnancies due to unprotected intercourse, failure of contraceptives or rapes.
MTPs are also essential when continuation of pregnancy could be harmful or fatal to the ______ or the foetus or both.
MTPs are considered relatively safe during the ______ trimester.
MTPs are safe up to ______ weeks of pregnancy.
Second trimester abortions are much more ______.
A disturbing trend is that a majority of the MTPs are performed illegally by unqualified ______.
Illegal MTPs performed by unqualified quacks are not only unsafe but could be ______.
Another dangerous trend is the misuse of ______ to determine the sex of the unborn child.
If the foetus is found to be ______, it is frequently followed by MTP.
Such sex-selective MTPs are totally against what is ______.
Pills have to be taken daily for a period of 21 days starting within the first five days of the ______ cycle.
After a gap of 7 days during which ______ occurs, pills have to be repeated.
Emergency contraceptives can prevent possible pregnancy due to ______ unprotected intercourse.
Surgical methods are generally advised for the male/female partner to prevent any more ______.
Figure 3.3 represents ______.
Figure 3.4 (a) represents ______.
Figure 3.4 (b) represents ______.
MTP is also called induced ______.
The debate on legalisation of MTP is due to emotional, ethical, religious and ______ issues.
MTPs account to 1/5th of the total number of ______ pregnancies in a year.
Such restrictions are important to check illegal female ______.
MTPs are considered relatively safe up to ______ weeks.
Second trimester ______ are much riskier.
Another disturbing trend is the misuse of amniocentesis to determine the sex of the ______ child.
Saheli is an oral contraceptive for ______.
Saheli has very few ______ and high contraceptive value.
Progestogen-estrogen combinations can be used as ______ or implants.
Administration of IUDs within 72 hours of coitus is effective as ______ contraceptive.
Sterilisation is a ______ method of contraception.
Government of India legalised ______ in 1971 with strict conditions.
MTPs help to get rid of pregnancies due to failure of ______ used during coitus.
MTPs are essential when continuation of pregnancy could be harmful to the mother or the ______.
Unqualified quacks performing MTPs make them ______ and fatal.
Amniocentesis is misused to determine the sex of the ______.
Sex-selective abortion following amniocentesis is totally against what is ______.
The contraceptive pills are popularly called the ______.
Pills alter the quality of cervical ______ to prevent entry of sperms.
Progestogens can be used in combination with ______.
Implants are placed under the ______.
Emergency contraceptives can be used within ______ hours of coitus.
Surgical sterilisation is done in ______ and tubectomy.
Nearly 45 to 50 million ______ are performed in a year all over the world.
Female foeticides are reported to be high in ______.
MTPs are safe during the ______ trimester of pregnancy.
Abortions in the ______ trimester are much more riskier.
